page.title: 08Forestry in Cannock Chase
page.content: In Cannock Chase the{original forest} of birch, elder and oak has largely disappeared. This has been partly replaced by dense coniferous forest, planted by the {Forestry Commission.} Planting started in 1923, and these trees have already been harvested. The cycle from planting to harvest takes approximately 55 years. In this area we can see all the stages of cultivation, from preparation of the soil, to planting, weeding, thinning out and felling of the trees. There are some broad-leaved trees such as silver birch and oak which are used for landscaping. Originally scots pine were the main type of trees that were planted. As these were felled they were replaced by corsican pine. These were able to give higher timber yields and offered more resistance to pests and disease.
